00008   /******************************************************
00009     construct from LCObject
00010   ******************************************************/
00011   SatCorrItep::SatCorrItep( EVENT::LCObject* obj ) : _scaling( 1.0 ), _procedureType ( 0 )
00012   {
00013    
00014     EVENT::LCGenericObject* gObj = dynamic_cast< EVENT::LCGenericObject* >( obj );
00015 
00016     if ( gObj == NULL )
00017       throw std::invalid_argument( "SatCorrItep: this LCObject is not LCGenericObject" );
00018 
00019     if ( gObj->getNInt() != 1 || gObj->getNFloat()%2 != 0 )
00020       throw std::invalid_argument( "SatCorrItep: suspicious number of elements in this LCGenericObject" );
00021 
00022     setIntVal( 0, gObj->getIntVal( 0 ) );
00023 
00024     for ( int i = 0; i != gObj->getNFloat(); ++i )
00025       setFloatVal( i, gObj->getFloatVal( i ) );
00026       
00027     setFunParameters(1156.,0.8,0.7); //2-exp default parameters
00028   }

00031   /**************************************************
00032     construct from HcalTileIndex
00033   ************************************************/
00034   SatCorrItep::SatCorrItep( const HcalTileIndex& hti,
00035                             const unsigned int nPoints,
00036                             const float* pixs,
00037                             const float* pmts ) : _scaling( 1.0 ), _procedureType ( 0 )
00038   {
00039     setIndex( hti );
00040 
00041     for ( unsigned int i = 0; i != nPoints; ++i )
00042       {
00043         setPix( i, pixs[i] );
00044         setPmt( i, pmts[i] );
00045       }
00046    
00047     setFunParameters(1156.,0.8,0.7); //2-exp default parameters 
00048   }

00056   /************************************************
00057    deSaturate
00058   ************************************************/
00059   float SatCorrItep::deSaturate( const float saturatedSignal ) const
00060   {
00061     
00062     /*  protect against negative/zero input*/
00063     if ( saturatedSignal <= 0 ) return saturatedSignal;
00064 
00065     /*  scale the input value by 1/_scaling,
00066         equivalent to scaling with _scaling of all pixel values in curve
00067     */
00068     float satScale = saturatedSignal / _scaling;
00069     
00070     /*  if below first point in curve, do nothing*/
00071     if ( satScale < getPix( 0 ) )
00072       return saturatedSignal * getPmt( 0 ) / getPix( 0 );
00073 
00074     int nPairs = getNFloat()/2;
00075     
00076 
00077     /*************************************************************************/
00078     /*  check for cut-off beyond last measured point
00079      */
00080     //if ( satScale >= getPix( nPairs - 1 ) ) return getPmt( nPairs - 1 ) * _scaling;
00081     /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00082     /*do not cut-off, but do a linear extrapolation from the last 2 points
00083       Slope must be positive. If not, take the next lower points...
00084     */
00085     
00086     if ( satScale >= getPix( nPairs - 1 ) )
00087       {
00088         float slopeLast   = 0;
00089         int iLastPositive = 0;
00090 
00091         for (int i = nPairs - 1; i > 0; --i)
00092           {
00093             slopeLast = ( getPmt(i) - getPmt(i - 1) ) / ( getPix(i) - getPix(i - 1) );
00094 
00095             if (slopeLast > 0)
00096               {
00097                 iLastPositive = i;
00098                 break;
00099               }
00100           }
00101         
00102         float extrapolationLast =  getPmt(iLastPositive - 1) + slopeLast * ( satScale - getPix(iLastPositive - 1) );
00103         return _scaling * extrapolationLast;
00104 
00105       }
00106 
00107     // find index of the measured point closest but lower to the input
00108     int iUpper = 0;
00109     while ( satScale >= getPix( iUpper ) )  ++iUpper;
00110     int iLower = iUpper - 1;
00111 
00112     //  return linear interpolation between points iLower and iLower+1
00113     float slope = ( getPmt( iUpper ) - getPmt( iLower ) )
00114       / ( getPix( iUpper ) - getPix( iLower ) );
00115 
00116     float extrapolation =
00117       getPmt( iLower ) + slope * ( satScale - getPix( iLower ) );
00118  
00119     return _scaling * extrapolation;
00120     
00121   }
00122

00125   /************************************************
00126    deSaturatedError
00127   ************************************************/
00128   float SatCorrItep::deSaturatedError( const float saturatedSignal,
00129                                        const float saturatedSignalError ) const
00130   {
00131     /*  relative error same as input*/
00132     return saturatedSignalError / saturatedSignal
00133       * deSaturate( saturatedSignal );
00134   }

00137   /************************************************
00138    saturate
00139   ************************************************/
00140   float SatCorrItep::saturate( const float unSaturatedSignal ) const
00141   {
00142     
00143     /*  protect against negative/zero input*/
00144     if ( unSaturatedSignal <= 0 ) return unSaturatedSignal;
00145 
00146     /*  curve should be scaled - scale input instead*/
00147     float linScale = unSaturatedSignal / _scaling;
00148     
00149     /*  if below first point in curve, do nothing*/
00150     if ( linScale < getPmt( 0 ) )
00151       return unSaturatedSignal * getPix( 0 ) / getPmt( 0 );
00152 
00153     if ( _procedureType == 0 ) { //make the interpolation 
00154 
00155 
00156     //  check for cut-off beyond last measured point
00157     int nPairs = getNFloat()/2;
00158     //if ( linScale >= getPmt( nPairs - 1 ) ) return getPix( nPairs - 1 ) * _scaling;
00159 
00160     //do not cut-off, but use linear extrapolation of the last 2 points
00161     if ( linScale >= getPmt( nPairs - 1 ) )
00162       {
00163         float slopeLast   = 0;
00164         int iLastPositive = 0;
00165 
00166         for (int i = nPairs - 1; i > 0; --i)
00167           {
00168             slopeLast = ( getPix(i) - getPix(i-1)) / (getPmt(i) - getPmt(i-1));
00169             if (slopeLast > 0)
00170               {
00171                 iLastPositive = i;
00172                 break;
00173               }
00174           }
00175           
00176         float extrapolationLast = getPix(iLastPositive - 1) + slopeLast * (linScale - getPmt(iLastPositive - 1));
00177         
00178         return _scaling * extrapolationLast;
00179       }
00180 
00181     //  find index of the measured point closest but lower to the input
00182     int iUpper = 0;
00183     while ( linScale >= getPmt( iUpper ) )
00184       ++iUpper;
00185     int iLower = iUpper - 1;
00186 
00187     //  extract linear interpolation between points iLower and iLower+1
00188     float slope = ( getPix( iUpper ) - getPix( iLower ) )
00189       / ( getPmt( iUpper ) - getPmt( iLower ) );
00190     float extrapolation = getPix( iLower )
00191       + slope * ( linScale - getPmt( iLower ) );
00192       
00193     //  pixel axis is scaled by _scaling: 
00194     return _scaling * extrapolation;
00195       
00196     } //_procedureType == 0
00197     
00198     else { //make pure curve saturation
00199         float p0 = getFunParam0();
00200         float p1 = getFunParam1();
00201         float p2 = getFunParam2();
00202         float x = linScale;
00203         //double exp
00204         float extrapolation = p0*(p1*(1-exp(-p2*x/p0)) + (1-p1)*(1-exp(-(1-p2*p1)*x/(p0*(1-p1)))) );
00205            
00206     //  pixel axis is scaled by _scaling:
00207     return _scaling * extrapolation;
00208     }
00209     
00210 
00211     
00212   }
00213

00215   /************************************************
00216    saturatedError
00217   ************************************************/
00218   float SatCorrItep::saturatedError( const float unSaturatedSignal,
00219                                      const float unSaturatedSignalError ) const
00220   {
00221     /*  relative error same as input*/
00222     return unSaturatedSignalError / unSaturatedSignal
00223       * saturate( unSaturatedSignal );
00224   }
